result.execSummary:
The defendant Buffy M Wollitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Buffy M Wollitz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Buffy M Wollitz was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Sentence to commence immediately. Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. Court grants the defendant 40 days of sentence credit.
Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
2:14 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2015CM267, count 1 on 2016CM109 and count 1 on 2016CM243.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 on 2015CM267, and orders count 1 be dismissed outright and orders count 3 be dismissed and readin.  Court orders 2016CM97 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2016CM109 and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant Guilty as charged on count 1 in 2016CM243.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CM267 (Count 2)

-45 days county jail.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-$600 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 24 months
-IID - 24 months
-AODA (GL)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CM109 (Count 1)

-10 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CM243 (Count 1)

-30 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 40 days 15CM267 and 1 day on 16CM243.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 2:28 p.m.
